item.title: The less trodden path with sqlite
item.description: Lately, I’ve been tinkering around a bit with sqlite3, and this post contains a brief of some exciting set of features and interfaces that I’ve re-discovered during the process. sqlite3 isn’t exactly new. It’s been around for almost two decades now (much longer than I’ve known coding myself ðŸ˜›). There’s plethora of articles on the internet describing what it is, what makes it special, when you should ideally use it (and when not) and why “it’s the only database you will ever need”.
